comment.body:
Do we know 100% whether `__DEV__` is always defined? If not I would suggest doing:

```suggestion
  return typeof __DEV__ !== undefined && __DEV__ ? 'development' : 'production';
```

That way it doesn't throw if it isn't defined.

pull_request.title: feat(sdk): Automatically detect environment if not set by User
pull_request.body:
## :loudspeaker: Type of change
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [x] New feature

## :scroll: Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
Detection is based on the JS environment and the global `__DEV__` property user can override the value.

This change might affect users not setting the environment option at the moment. As their dev builds will now have `development` environment.

## :bulb: Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
- https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-react-native/issues/2801

## :green_heart: How did you test it?
sample app, tests

## :pencil: Checklist
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [x] I reviewed submitted code
- [x] I added tests to verify changes
- [x] No new PII added or SDK only sends newly added PII if `sendDefaultPII` is enabled
- [x] All tests passing
- [x] No breaking changes

## :crystal_ball: Next steps

commits.message:
Fix 5.11.0 changelog (#3335)

Cancel background transaction on app in background was in 5.10.0 in the changelog but actually released in 5.11.0

chore(deps): update JavaScript SDK to v7.75.1 (#3344)

Co-authored-by: GitHub <noreply@github.com>

issue.title: Upload Sourcemaps from `eas update`
issue.body:
<!-- Please clarify if this feature is for Flutter or just Dart (i.e AngularDart, CLI, Server) -->

A huge, huge painpoint currently is uploading sourcemaps from the result of `npx eas update` (Expo's over-the-air update service). It works for `eas build` for new builds, but not for updates. There are what feels like dozens of issues and feature requests for this on the Expo repo. It requires a script that reads the outputs of `dist` and uploads them to Sentry.

Could you please add a CLI script to this? The Expo team has said they've tried contacting Sentry about it. Some sort of `postPublish` hook in the `app.config.ts` file would be a great DX. 

I currently cannot use Sentry in React Native easily due to this, since most of our updates happen over-the-air. It would be a huge contribution to over a hundred devs I know of to fix this.

Thank you!

comment.body:
Hi @nandorojo,
thank you for the message, we are aware of this and are working with the Expo team.

Currently, we are starting the process of moving away from `sentry-expo` to `sentry-react-native` supporting Expo out of the box.

- https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-react-native/issues/3262

And one of the items on the features list is `sourcemaps for eas update`.

pull_request.title: chore(deps): update JavaScript SDK to v7.75.1
pull_request.body:
Bumps scripts/update-javascript.sh from 7.73.0 to 7.75.1.

Auto-generated by a [dependency updater](https://github.com/getsentry/github-workflows/blob/main/.github/workflows/updater.yml).
## Changelog
### 7.75.1

- feat(browser): Allow collecting of pageload profiles ([#9317](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9317))
- fix(browser): Correct timestamp on pageload profiles ([#9350](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9350))
- fix(nextjs): Use webpack plugin release value to inject release ([#9348](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9348))

### 7.75.0

#### Important Changes

- **feat(opentelemetry): Add new `sentry/opentelemetry` package ([#9238](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9238))**

This release publishes a new package, `sentry/opentelemetry`. This is a runtime agnostic replacement for `sentry/opentelemetry-node` and exports a couple of useful utilities which can be used to use Sentry together with OpenTelemetry.

You can read more about [sentry/opentelemetry in the Readme](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/tree/develop/packages/opentelemetry).

- **feat(replay): Allow to treeshake rrweb features ([#9274](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9274))**

Starting with this release, you can configure the following build-time flags in order to reduce the SDK bundle size:

* `__RRWEB_EXCLUDE_CANVAS__`
* `__RRWEB_EXCLUDE_IFRAME__`
* `__RRWEB_EXCLUDE_SHADOW_DOM__`

You can read more about [tree shaking in our docs](https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/configuration/tree-shaking/).


#### Other Changes

- build(deno): Prepare Deno SDK for release on npm ([#9281](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9281))
- feat: Remove tslib ([#9299](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9299))
- feat(node): Add abnormal session support for ANR ([#9268](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9268))
- feat(node): Remove `lru_map` dependency ([#9300](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9300))
- feat(node): Vendor `cookie` module ([#9308](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9308))
- feat(replay): Share performance instrumentation with tracing ([#9296](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9296))
- feat(types): Add missing Profiling types (macho debug image, profile measurements, stack frame properties) ([#9277](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9277))
- feat(types): Add statsd envelope types ([#9304](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9304))
- fix(astro): Add integration default export to types entry point ([#9337](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9337))
- fix(astro): Convert SDK init file import paths to POSIX paths ([#9336](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9336))
- fix(astro): Make `Replay` and `BrowserTracing` integrations tree-shakeable ([#9287](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9287))
- fix(integrations): Fix transaction integration ([#9334](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9334))
- fix(nextjs): Restore `autoInstrumentMiddleware` functionality ([#9323](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9323))
- fix(nextjs): Guard for case where `getInitialProps` may return undefined ([#9342](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9342))
- fix(node-experimental): Make node-fetch support optional ([#9321](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9321))
- fix(node): Check buffer length when attempting to parse ANR frame ([#9314](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9314))
- fix(replay): Fix xhr start timestamps ([#9341](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9341))
- fix(tracing-internal): Remove query params from urls with a trailing slash ([#9328](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9328))
- fix(types): Remove typo with CheckInEnvelope ([#9303](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9303))

### 7.74.1

- chore(astro): Add `astro-integration` keyword ([#9265](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9265))
- fix(core): Narrow filters for health check transactions ([#9257](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9257))
- fix(nextjs): Fix HMR by inserting new entrypoints at the end ([#9267](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9267))
- fix(nextjs): Fix resolution of request async storage module ([#9259](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9259))
- fix(node-experimental): Guard against missing `fetch` ([#9275](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9275))
- fix(remix): Update `defer` injection logic. ([#9242](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9242))
- fix(tracing-internal): Parameterize express middleware parameters ([#8668](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/8668))
- fix(utils): Move Node specific ANR impl. out of utils ([#9258](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9258))

Work in this release contributed by LubomirIgonda1. Thank you for your contribution!

### 7.74.0

#### Important Changes

- **feat(astro): Add `sentryAstro` integration ([#9218](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9218))**

This Release introduces the first alpha version of our new SDK for Astro.
At this time, the SDK is considered experimental and things might break and change in future versions.

The core of the SDK is an Astro integration which you easily add to your Astro config:

```js
// astro.config.js
import { defineConfig } from "astro/config";
import sentry from "sentry/astro";

export default defineConfig({
  integrations: [
    sentry({
      dsn: "__DSN__",
      sourceMapsUploadOptions: {
        project: "astro",
        authToken: process.env.SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN,
      },
    }),
  ],
});
```

Check out the [README](./packages/astro/README.md) for usage instructions and what to expect from this alpha release.

#### Other Changes

- feat(core): Add `addIntegration` utility ([#9186](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9186))
- feat(core): Add `continueTrace` method ([#9164](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9164))
- feat(node-experimental): Add NodeFetch integration ([#9226](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9226))
- feat(node-experimental): Use native OTEL Spans ([#9161](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9161), [#9214](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9214))
- feat(node-experimental): Sample in OTEL Sampler ([#9203](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9203))
- feat(serverlesss): Allow disabling transaction traces ([#9154](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9154))
- feat(tracing): Allow direct pg module to enable esbuild support ([#9227](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9227))
- feat(utils): Move common node ANR code to utils ([#9191](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9191))
- feat(vue): Expose `VueIntegration` to initialize vue app later ([#9180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9180))
- fix: Don't set `referrerPolicy` on serverside fetch transports ([#9200](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9200))
- fix: Ensure we never mutate options passed to `init` ([#9162](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9162))
- fix(ember): Avoid pulling in utils at build time ([#9221](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9221))
- fix(ember): Drop undefined config values ([#9175](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9175))
- fix(node): Ensure mysql integration works without callback ([#9222](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9222))
- fix(node): Only require `inspector` when needed ([#9149](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9149))
- fix(node): Remove ANR `debug` option and instead add logger.isEnabled() ([#9230](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9230))
- fix(node): Strip `.mjs` and `.cjs` extensions from module name ([#9231](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9231))
- fix(replay): bump rrweb to 2.0.1 ([#9240](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9240))
- fix(replay): Fix potential broken CSS in styled-components ([#9234](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9234))
- fix(sveltekit): Flush in server wrappers before exiting ([#9153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9153))
- fix(types): Update signature of `processEvent` integration hook ([#9151](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9151))
- fix(utils): Dereference DOM events after they have servered their purpose ([#9224](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9224))
- ref(integrations): Refactor pluggable integrations to use `processEvent` ([#9021](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9021))
- ref(serverless): Properly deprecate `rethrowAfterCapture` option ([#9159](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9159))
- ref(utils): Deprecate `walk` method ([#9157](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9157))

Work in this release contributed by aldenquimby. Thank you for your contributions!

This release publishes a new package, `sentry/opentelemetry`. This is a runtime agnostic replacement for `sentry/opentelemetry-node` and exports a couple of useful utilities which can be used to use Sentry together with OpenTelemetry.

### 7.74.0

#### Important Changes

- **feat(astro): Add `sentryAstro` integration ([#9218](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9218))**

This Release introduces the first alpha version of our new SDK for Astro.
At this time, the SDK is considered experimental and things might break and change in future versions.

The core of the SDK is an Astro integration which you easily add to your Astro config:

```js
// astro.config.js
import { defineConfig } from "astro/config";
import sentry from "sentry/astro";

export default defineConfig({
  integrations: [
    sentry({
      dsn: "__DSN__",
      sourceMapsUploadOptions: {
        project: "astro",
        authToken: process.env.SENTRY_AUTH_TOKEN,
      },
    }),
  ],
});
```

Check out the [README](./packages/astro/README.md) for usage instructions and what to expect from this alpha release.

#### Other Changes

- feat(vue): Expose `VueIntegration` to initialize vue app later ([#9180](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9180))
- fix: Don't set `referrerPolicy` on serverside fetch transports ([#9200](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9200))
- fix: Ensure we never mutate options passed to `init` ([#9162](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9162))
- fix(ember): Avoid pulling in utils at build time ([#9221](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9221))

- fix(replay): bump rrweb to 2.0.1 ([#9240](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9240))
- fix(replay): Fix potential broken CSS in styled-components ([#9234](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9234))
- fix(sveltekit): Flush in server wrappers before exiting ([#9153](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9153))
- fix(types): Update signature of `processEvent` integration hook ([#9151](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9151))
- fix(utils): Dereference DOM events after they have servered their purpose ([#9224](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9224))
- ref(integrations): Refactor pluggable integrations to use `processEvent` ([#9021](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9021))
- ref(serverless): Properly deprecate `rethrowAfterCapture` option ([#9159](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9159))
- ref(utils): Deprecate `walk` method ([#9157](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/getsentry/sentry-javascript/issues/9157))

Work in this release contributed by aldenquimby. Thank you for your contributions!

issue.title: Sentry.captureMessage Stack Trace is not symbolicated
issue.body: ### Environment What version are you running? Etc. @sentry/cli@2.17.1 @sentry/core@7.47.0 @sentry/hub@7.47.0 @sentry/integrations@7.47.0 @sentry/react-native@5.3.1 ### Steps to Reproduce 1. I try to upload debug files using following command ion iOS `../node_modules/@sentry/cli/bin/sentry-cli debug-files upload "$INCLUDE_SOURCES_FLAG" "$DWARF_DSYM_FOLDER_PATH" --project XXX` 2. I can see that the debug-files and source maps are uploaded under Sentry project settings. 3. I try to test following scenarios in my app - Invoke `Sentry.captureException()` -> Sentry logs correctly point to the exact line number in the JS file ✅ - Enable `enableCaptureFailedRequests: true` & simulate a network error -> Works as expected, Sentry shows the network error logs ✅ - Invoke `Sentry.captureMessage('Logging information for testing', 'warning')` -> Sentry captures the log but says '`Source code was not found`' ❓ ![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-cli/assets/30233361/a3fe69dd-ae12-414a-a24c-2959220de770) - Invoke `Sentry.nativeCrash()` to simulate a native crash -> Sentry captures the error but says '`A required debug information file was missing`'❓ Some of the logs are readable and only crashes and `Sentry.captureMessage` are having issues finding the correct symbols and debug files. ### Expected Result Native crashes and `Sentry.captureMessage` should map debug symbols and point to the exact error. ### More information Sourcemaps and debug files are uploaded in Sentry. ![image](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-cli/assets/30233361/b28857fe-76d6-44f1-8882-cd10627948a2)

comment.body: @Off2Race Thank you for the message, we will focus on fixing the `captureMessage`.

issue.title: Xcode Archive fails with "No such file or directory (os error 2)" in Bundle React Native code and images
issue.body:
**OS:**
- [X]  MacOS

**Platform:**
- [X]  iOS

**SDK:**
- [X]  `@sentry/react-native`

**SDK version:** 5.9.2

**`react-native` version:** 0.67.5

**Are you using Expo?**
- [X]  No

**Are you using sentry.io or on-premise?**
- [X]  sentry.io (SaaS)

---
**I have following issue:**

With @sentry/react-native 5.9.2 and @sentry/cli 2.20.7, the Xcode Archive command succeeds without issue.

If I upgrade @sentry/cli to 2.21.1 (with no other changes), I get the error shown below during the Bundle React Native code and images phase of the build.

```
info Writing bundle output to:, /Users/mikeloos/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Questing-clqhjnzhujzcdfexariyjgtaqqsg/Build/Intermediates.noindex/ArchiveIntermediates/Questing/BuildProductsPath/Release-iphoneos/main.jsbundle
info Writing sourcemap output to:, /Users/mikeloos/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Questing-clqhjnzhujzcdfexariyjgtaqqsg/Build/Intermediates.noindex/ArchiveIntermediates/Questing/IntermediateBuildFilesPath/Questing.build/Release-iphoneos/Questing.build/DerivedSources/main.jsbundle.map
info Done writing bundle output
info Done writing sourcemap output
info Copying 49 asset files
info Done copying assets
+ [[ true != true ]]
+ EXTRA_COMPILER_ARGS=
+ [[ false == true ]]
+ EXTRA_COMPILER_ARGS=-O
+ [[ '' == true ]]
+ /Users/mikeloos/Code/questing/client/questing/mobile/node_modules/@sentry/cli/sentry-cli -emit-binary -O -out /Users/mikeloos/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Questing-clqhjnzhujzcdfexariyjgtaqqsg/Build/Intermediates.noindex/ArchiveIntermediates/Questing/BuildProductsPath/Release-iphoneos/Questing.app/main.jsbundle /Users/mikeloos/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/Questing-clqhjnzhujzcdfexariyjgtaqqsg/Build/Intermediates.noindex/ArchiveIntermediates/Questing/BuildProductsPath/Release-iphoneos/main.jsbundle
error: No such file or directory (os error 2)
```
I tried (unsuccessfully) to set the log level higher to get more information but nothing additional was displayed.

The script for the Bundle React Native code and images phase is very standard. See below.
```
export SENTRY_PROPERTIES=sentry.properties
export EXTRA_PACKAGER_ARGS="--sourcemap-output $DERIVED_FILE_DIR/main.jsbundle.map"

../node_modules/@sentry/cli/bin/sentry-cli react-native xcode
../node_modules/react-native/scripts/react-native-xcode.sh
../node_modules/@sentry/react-native/scripts/collect-modules.sh
```
If I downgrade the CLI back to 2.20.7, this issue goes away.

If I add the following line to the above script, the issue also goes away.

```
export USE_HERMES=0
```
This might seem like an odd thing to try but I got the idea while poking around the Xcode log. The app does not use Hermes, so I figured that setting this flag would be otherwise harmless.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Upgrade the CLI from 2.20.7 to 2.21.1. See more details above.

**Actual result:**
Xcode archive fails

**Expected result:**
Xcode archive succeeds

comment.body:
Hi, @krystofwoldrich – Is this issue resolved in sentry-react-native 5.11.0? It appears that the root fix was included in sentry-cli 2.21.2, which is a dependency of 5.11.0 but I wanted to ask to make sure before upgrading.

If I'm correct, perhaps you might add a note to the 5.11.0 release notes? :)

issue.title: `Sentry.wrap` was called before `Sentry.init` warning when using CodePush.getUpdateMetadata
issue.body: **OS:** - [ ] Windows - [x] MacOS - [ ] Linux **Platform:** - [x] iOS - [x] Android **SDK:** - [x] `@sentry/react-native` (>= 1.0.0) - [ ] `react-native-sentry` (<= 0.43.2) **SDK version:** 5.11.1 **`react-native` version:** 0.72.4 **Are you using Expo?** - [ ] Yes - [x] No **Are you using sentry.io or on-premise?** - [x] sentry.io (SaaS) - [ ] on-premise **If you are using sentry.io, please post a link to your issue so we can take a look:** [Link to issue] **Configuration:** (`@sentry/react-native`) ``` export async function initSentry() { const update = await CodePush.getUpdateMetadata(); const codePushSentryRelease = Config.ENV === 'dev' ? codePushProps.staging.sentryRelease : codePushProps.production.sentryRelease; const configSentryRelease = Platform.OS === 'ios' ? IOS_SENTRY_RELEASE : ANDROID_SENTRY_RELEASE; Sentry.init({ dsn: 'https://xxx@xxx.ingest.sentry.io/xxx', environment: Config.env === 'dev' ? 'staging' : 'production', release: `${configSentryRelease}+${update ? codePushSentryRelease : Config.VERSION_CODE}`, dist: Config.VERSION_CODE, integrations: [ new Sentry.ReactNativeTracing({ tracePropagationTargets: ['localhost', Config.MY_API], }), ], }); } ``` --- **I have the following issue:** If using `await CodePush.getUpdateMetadata();` I'm getting a warning: App Start Span could not be finished. `Sentry.wrap` was called before `Sentry.init`. Also, I'm not sure if the following issue is related to wrapping before init: **Steps to reproduce:** Basically setup App like stated here: https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/react-native/manual-setup/codepush/ **Expected result:** I'm aware that the docs say it's not recommended because of the delay for getting early errors. But is it okay to do it this way? If it's, the warning can be supressed? Should I init sentry with basic config and init it again with codepush info? Are the `missing span instrumentation` on sentry.io related to this? Thanks for any help!

commits.message:
Revert "Update default xcode version to 14.3"

This reverts commit ad4663893c340686bccea5537250d96f4c210cbc.

issue.title: feat(sdk): Automatically detect environment if not set by User
issue.body:
## :loudspeaker: Type of change
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [x] New feature

## :scroll: Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
Detection is based on the JS environment and the global `__DEV__` property user can override the value.

This change might affect users not setting the environment option at the moment. As their dev builds will now have `development` environment.

## :bulb: Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
- https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-react-native/issues/2801

## :green_heart: How did you test it?
sample app, tests

## :pencil: Checklist
<!--- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [x] I reviewed submitted code
- [x] I added tests to verify changes
- [x] No new PII added or SDK only sends newly added PII if `sendDefaultPII` is enabled
- [x] All tests passing
- [x] No breaking changes

## :crystal_ball: Next steps

issue.title: `Sentry.wrap` was called before `Sentry.init` warning when using CodePush.getUpdateMetadata
issue.body: **OS:** - [ ] Windows - [x] MacOS - [ ] Linux **Platform:** - [x] iOS - [x] Android **SDK:** - [x] `@sentry/react-native` (>= 1.0.0) - [ ] `react-native-sentry` (<= 0.43.2) **SDK version:** 5.11.1 **`react-native` version:** 0.72.4 **Are you using Expo?** - [ ] Yes - [x] No **Are you using sentry.io or on-premise?** - [x] sentry.io (SaaS) - [ ] on-premise **If you are using sentry.io, please post a link to your issue so we can take a look:** [Link to issue] **Configuration:** (`@sentry/react-native`) ``` export async function initSentry() { const update = await CodePush.getUpdateMetadata(); const codePushSentryRelease = Config.ENV === 'dev' ? codePushProps.staging.sentryRelease : codePushProps.production.sentryRelease; const configSentryRelease = Platform.OS === 'ios' ? IOS_SENTRY_RELEASE : ANDROID_SENTRY_RELEASE; Sentry.init({ dsn: 'https://xxx@xxx.ingest.sentry.io/xxx', environment: Config.env === 'dev' ? 'staging' : 'production', release: `${configSentryRelease}+${update ? codePushSentryRelease : Config.VERSION_CODE}`, dist: Config.VERSION_CODE, integrations: [ new Sentry.ReactNativeTracing({ tracePropagationTargets: ['localhost', Config.MY_API], }), ], }); } ``` --- **I have the following issue:** If using `await CodePush.getUpdateMetadata();` I'm getting a warning: App Start Span could not be finished. `Sentry.wrap` was called before `Sentry.init`. Also, I'm not sure if the following issue is related to wrapping before init: **Steps to reproduce:** Basically setup App like stated here: https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/react-native/manual-setup/codepush/ **Expected result:** I'm aware that the docs say it's not recommended because of the delay for getting early errors. But is it okay to do it this way? If it's, the warning can be supressed? Should I init sentry with basic config and init it again with codepush info? Are the `missing span instrumentation` on sentry.io related to this? Thanks for any help!

comment.body:
Hi,
thank you for the message,
the warning only shows in dev builds, in production it's disabled.

The `missing span instrumentation` is not caused by it. 

I would recommend using `Sentry.withProfiler(YourComponent)` on your app components, this will automatically create spans when you components are mounted.

issue.title: > Task :app:bundleReleaseJsAndAssets_SentryUpload ... FAILED
issue.body: ### Environment How do you use Sentry? Sentry SaaS (sentry.io) Which SDK and version? `"@sentry/react-native": "3.4.3",` ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Building android using Fastlane 2. Sentry integration is set to default using sentry-wizard 3. Previously was working using this task `> Task :app:bundleReleaseJsAndAssets_SentryUpload_com.wander.com.app@1.1.2+2112328043_2112328043` 4. Nothing was changed in sentry integration but android using this task `> Task :app:bundleReleaseJsAndAssets_SentryUpload_com.wander.com.app@1.1.2+-2095294253_-2095294253 FAILED` 5. Notice the differences between task name with `-` sign and without it ### Expected Result Build without failing :) ### Actual Result I think somewhere the Android sentryUpload task is auto generating the id/number with a `- sign`. I double checked if we changed/updated something in the code base after the this task was failing and I confirm that there was no major update, only small UI updates. wdyt @marandaneto ![Screenshot 2022-06-22 at 16 31 34](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3584560/175044318-c34cae30-dd97-4f1e-b242-88fe113def99.png)

comment.body:
Commenting to say what fixed it for me.

 I upgraded the version from 5.6.0 to 5.11.1, then ran a `./gradlew clean`. I no longer hit this error and can build fine now.
